result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Dean Schaller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas Dean Schaller is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas Dean Schaller was found guilty of Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall pay restitution and 10% restitution surcharge in an amount to be determined within 24 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court.

Defendant's bond shall remain in effect during said Diversion Agreement.

Defendant shall file monthly written reports with the Monroe County Justice Department certifying the defendant's compliance with the conditions specified in the agreement.

The defendant shall provide any change of address information to the Monroe County Justice Department and Monroe County Clerk of Circuit Court within 24 hours of said change.

Defendant will pay a $20.00 per month Diversion Agreement fee to the Justice Program Coordinator or designee by the 5th day of each month.

Defendant shall meet in person with the Justice Program Coordinator or designee approximately every three (3) months while the Diversion Agreement is in effect.

Defendant shall appear in court at a review hearing approximately four (4) months after the Court's approval of the agreement.  The court will schedule the review hearing and send notice to the defendant at the most recent address provided to the Clerk of Court's office.

Defendant shall write an appropriate letter of apology to the victim in this case within 3 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court and shall submit the letter to the Monroe County Justice Department, and if deemed appropriate, shall be forwarded to the victim.

The agreement can end after a period of 2 years if all of the requirements of the agreement have been successfully completed.

Defendant to comply with all other terms and conditions of this Agreement.

timeConds.notes: Defendant shall complete 150 hours of community service within 33 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court and provide the Monroe County Justice Department, Justice Program Coordinator or designee, with verification of said hours.

miscConds.notes: Pay balance of restitution owing in the amount of $1,556.92 and restitution surcharge of $178.35 for a total of $1,735.27.
Court grants expungement if defendant successfully completes probation and pays restitution and surcharge in full.

Defendant may be released early from probation if restitution and surcharge are paid in full.

Comply with any conditions per agent.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
